setting.description: This text will be displayed on both the About and Submissions pages. It should outline any fees associated with publishing in your journal.
setting.name: publication_fees

value.default: You should update this section to show any fees that your journal charges.

setting.description: Your publisher's URL.
setting.name: publisher_url

setting.description: Link to your privacy policy, which will appear in the footer. If this section is left blank, a link to the blank "/site/privacy" default page will be displayed. This page can be accessed through the Content manager.
setting.name: privacy_policy_url

setting.description: Name of the journal's publisher. Displayed throughout the site and metadata.
setting.name: publisher_name

setting.description: This text will be displayed on both the About and Submissions pages. It should contain your journal's copyright notice, providing the terms which authors agree to when publishing in your journal.
setting.name: copyright_notice

setting.description: This text will be displayed on the Submissions page. It should outline the criteria you use when deciding if an article will be accepted.
setting.name: acceptance_criteria

setting.description: Overrides the term "Collections" across all the templates.
setting.name: collection_name

setting.description: Overrides the term "Collections" across all the templates.
setting.name: collection_name_plural

setting.description: This text will be displayed on both the About and Submissions pages. It should provide an ordered list of submission requirements.
setting.name: submission_checklist

setting.description: System emails are sent from this address.
setting.name: from_address

setting.description: When recipients reply to emails sent through Janeway, their replies will be sent to this email address.
setting.name: replyto_address

setting.description: Email sent to editors when they are assigned to a submission.
setting.name: editor_assignment

value.default:
Dear {{ editor.salutation_name }},

You have been assigned as an editor to "{{ article.safe_title }}" in the journal {{ request.journal.name }}.

If you are unable to be the editor for this article, please reply to this email.

You can view this article's data on the journal site: {{ review_in_review_url }}

Regards,

{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to authors when they have submitted an article.
setting.name: submission_acknowledgement

value.default:
Dear {{ article.correspondence_author.salutation_name }},

Thank you for submitting "{{ article }}" to {{ article.journal }}.

Your work will now be reviewed by an editor and we will be in touch as the peer-review process progresses.

Regards,

setting.description: Email sent to editors when a reviewer accepts or declines a review.
setting.name: reviewer_acknowledgement

value.default:
Dear {{ review_assignment.editor.salutation_name }},

This is a notification that the reviewer {{ review_assignment.reviewer.full_name }} has responded to your review request for " #{{ article.pk }}: {{ article.safe_title }}" in {{ article.journal.name }} and have {{ reviewer_decision }} to perform the review. You can view more information on the journal site: {{ review_in_review_url }}

setting.description: Email sent to authors when requesting revisions.
setting.name: request_revisions

value.default:
Dear {{ article.correspondence_author.salutation_name|se_can_see_pii:article }},

We are requesting that you make some changes to your paper.

You can access your revision here: {{ do_revisions_url }}

Your revisions are due on {{ revision.date_due }}.

Regards,

{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to reviewers when they agree to undertake a review.
setting.name: review_accept_acknowledgement

value.default:
Dear {{ review_assignment.reviewer.salutation_name }},

Thank you for agreeing to review "{{ article.safe_title }}" in {{ article.journal.name }}.

You can now access the manuscript and the review process at: {{ review_url }}

Regards,
{{ review_assignment.editor.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to reviewers when they complete a review.
setting.name: review_complete_reviewer_acknowledgement

value.default:
Dear {{ review_assignment.reviewer.salutation_name }},

Thank you for completing your review of "{{ article.safe_title }}" in {{ article.journal.name }}.

We are extremely grateful for the work of reviewers, which greatly enhances the quality of the journal.

Thank you again and regards,

{{ review_assignment.editor.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent when a review assignment is updated.
setting.name: review_request_sent

value.default:
Dear {{ review_assignment.editor.salutation_name }},

This is a notification that the reviewer status on "{{ article.safe_title }}" in {{ article.journal.name }} has been updated.

Regards,
{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to editors when a reviewer completes a review.
setting.name: review_complete_acknowledgement

value.default:
Dear {{ review_assignment.editor.salutation_name }},

{{ review_assignment.reviewer.full_name }} has completed their review of "{{ review_assignment.article.title }}"{% if review_assignment.decision %} with this recommendation: {{ review_assignment.get_decision_display }}{% endif %}.

You can view more information on the journal site: {% journal_url 'review_view_review' review_assignment.article.pk review_assignment.pk %}

Regards,

setting.description: Email sent to reviewers when they decline to undertake a review.
setting.name: review_decline_acknowledgement

value.default:
Dear {{ review_assignment.reviewer.salutation_name }}, 

Thank you for letting us know that you are unable to review "{{ article.safe_title }}" in {{ article.journal.name }}.

 We are most grateful for your time.

Regards,
{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to reviewers to request a review.
setting.name: review_assignment

value.default:
Dear {{ review_assignment.reviewer.salutation_name }},

We are requesting that you undertake a review of "{{ article.safe_title }}" in {{ article.journal.name }}.

We would be most grateful for your time as the feedback from our reviewers is of the utmost importance to our editorial decision-making processes.

You can let us know your decision or decline to undertake the review: {{ review_url }}

{{ article_details }}

Regards,
{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email to remind reviewers of a new request.
setting.name: default_review_reminder

value.default:
Dear {{ review_assignment.reviewer.salutation_name }},

We recently sent you an email requesting that you undertake a review of "{{ article.safe_title }}" in {{ article.journal.name }}.

We would be most grateful for your time as the feedback from our reviewers is of the utmost importance to our editorial decision-making processes.

We would appreciate it if you could let us know your decision or decline to undertake the review: {{ review_url }}

Regards,
{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to notify reviewer of accepted request and remind them to review submission.
setting.name: accepted_review_reminder

value.default:
Dear {{ review_assignment.reviewer.salutation_name }},

You recently agreed undertake a review of "{{ article.safe_title }}" in {{ article.journal.name }}.

We would be most grateful for your time as the feedback from our reviewers is of the utmost importance to our editorial decision-making processes.

Check our site to undertake the review: {{ review_url }}

Regards,
{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to authors when an article is accepted.
setting.name: review_decision_accept

value.default:
Dear {{ article.correspondence_author.salutation_name|se_can_see_pii:article }},

We are happy to inform you that your article, "{{ article.safe_title }}", has been accepted in {{ article.journal.name }}. Thank you for submitting such a strong manuscript.

Peer review reports and feedback on the manuscript can be viewed at: {{ review_url }}

We will be back in touch soon to discuss the next stages of production.


Regards,


{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to authors when an article is declined.
setting.name: review_decision_decline

value.default:
Dear {{ article.correspondence_author.salutation_name|se_can_see_pii:article }},

We are sorry to inform you that "{{ article.safe_title }}" has been declined in {{ article.journal.name }}.

You can view your reviews and feedback on the manuscript at: {{ review_url }}

Regards,

{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to authors when a decision to decline an article is reversed.
setting.name: review_decision_undecline

value.default:
Dear {{ article.correspondence_author.salutation_name }},

We wish to inform you that the earlier decision to decline "{{ article.safe_title }}" in {{ article.journal.name }} has been reversed. The article is now being reconsidered.

Regards,

{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to editors when they are unassigned from an article.
setting.name: unassign_editor

value.default:
Dear {{ assignment.editor.salutation_name }},

We are writing to let you know that you have been unassigned from the article "{{ article.safe_title }}" in {{ article.journal.name }}.

Regards,

{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Subject for the email sent to editors when they are unassigned from an article.
setting.name: subject_unassign_editor

setting.description: Email sent to reviewers when a review request is withdrawn.
setting.name: review_withdrawl

value.default:
Dear {{ review_assignment.reviewer.salutation_name }},

We are writing to let you know that the review request for "{{ article.safe_title }}" in {{ article.journal.name }} has been cancelled.

We thank you for your time but your review is no longer required.

Regards,

{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Primary contact for the journal.
setting.name: main_contact

setting.description: Added onto the end of automated system emails (where no specific person is sending it).
setting.name: auto_signature

setting.description: The maximum number of preprint DOIs that are allowed each month without the author paying.
setting.name: max_dois

setting.description: Tick this box to allow authors to select to make their works publicly available during ongoing review.
setting.name: enable_preprints

setting.description: Tick this box to allow automatic notifications to be sent in a Slack or Discord channel.
setting.name: slack_logging

setting.description: Tick this box to use Crossref DOIs.
setting.name: use_crossref

setting.description: Tick this box to register DOIs with Crossref at acceptance automatically. If unticked, DOIs are generated at acceptance but should be manually registered. Has no effect if `use_crossref` is off.
setting.name: register_doi_at_acceptance

setting.description: Tick this box to use Crossref's test server.
setting.name: crossref_test

setting.description: The username to log in to Crossref's deposit API.
setting.name: crossref_username

setting.description: The password to log in to Crossref's deposit API.
setting.name: crossref_password

setting.description: The prefix for this journal on Crossref's system.
setting.name: crossref_prefix

setting.description: The name of the depositor for this journal on Crossref's system.
setting.name: crossref_name

setting.description: The email of the depositor for this journal on Crossref's system.
setting.name: crossref_email

setting.description: The name of the registrant for this journal on Crossref's system.
setting.name: crossref_registrant

setting.description: Text to prepend to DOIs. Also used to generate URLs.
setting.name: doi_display_prefix

setting.description: Text to append to DOIs. Also used to generate URLs.
setting.name: doi_display_suffix

setting.description: Name of the journal.
setting.name: journal_name

setting.description: The ISSN of the journal.
setting.name: journal_issn

setting.description: The ISSN of the printed version of the journal.
setting.name: print_issn

setting.description: The HTML theme set to use for the journal.
setting.name: journal_theme

setting.description: When using a custom theme, you can set the base theme. When a template from a custom theme is missing, templates from the base theme will be used as a backup.
setting.name: journal_base_theme

setting.description: Guide shown to copyeditors.
setting.name: copyediting_guidelines

setting.description: Guide shown to authors during copyediting.
setting.name: author_copyediting_guidelines

setting.description: Email sent to copyeditors notifying them of a new copyediting assignment.
setting.name: copyeditor_assignment_notification

value.default:
Dear {{ assignment.copyeditor.salutation_name }},

We are requesting that you undertake a copyedit for the article "{{ assignment.article.safe_title }}".

This assignment is due on {{ assignment.due }}. You can access this task on the journal site: {{ copyedit_requests_url }}


Regards,

{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to editors when copyedits are complete.
setting.name: copyeditor_notify_editor

value.default:
Dear {{ assignment.editor.salutation_name }},

The copyedit task is now complete. You can view more information in the journal site: {{ article_copyediting_url }}

Regards,
{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to authors asking them to review copyedits.
setting.name: copyeditor_notify_author

value.default:
Dear {{ assignment.article.correspondence_author.salutation_name }},

The copyeditor has completed their task, you can review the copyedits: {{ author_copyedit_url }}

Regards,
{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to copyeditors asking them to undertake further copyedits.
setting.name: copyeditor_reopen_task

value.default:
Dear {{ assignment.copyeditor.salutation_name }},

We are requesting further copyedits article "{{ assignment.article.safe_title }}". You can access this task on the journal site: {{ copyedit_requests_url }}

[ADD FEEDBACK HERE].

Regards,
{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to copyeditors to thank them.
setting.name: copyeditor_ack

value.default:
Dear {{ assignment.copyeditor.salutation_name }},

Thank you for your efforts in copyediting this article.

Regards,

{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to editors when an author copyedit review is complete.
setting.name: author_copyedit_complete

value.default:
Dear {{ copyedit.editor.salutation_name }},

The author {{ author_review.author.full_name }} has completed their review.

Their comments can be accessed here: {{ editor_review_url }}

setting.description: Guidelines displayed to typesetters.
setting.name: typesetting_guide

value.default:
When uploading galleys, please label them by the format, such as “XML” or “PDF”.

XML and HTML galleys can be previewed after uploading to check how they will be rendered when published.

The Galleys section should only contain one representative file for each format. If you are uploading the first version of a new format, please upload a new Galley (typeset file). If you are making revisions or corrections to an existing format, please use select Edit and then upload the new version, rather than adding a new Galley.

setting.description: Email sent to production managers notifying them of a new assignment.
setting.name: production_manager_notification

value.default:
Dear {{ production_assignment.production_manager.salutation_name }},

This is an automatic notification from {{ request.user.full_name }} that you have been assigned to the production of article {{ production_assignment.article.safe_title }}. You can view further information on this here: {{ production_article_url }}

Regards,

setting.description: Email sent to typesetters notifying them of a new assignment.
setting.name: typesetter_notification

value.default:
Dear {{ typeset_task.typesetter.salutation_name }},

This is a notification from {{ request.user.full_name }} that you have been assigned to the production of article {{ typeset_task.assignment.article.safe_title }}.

You can view further information on this here: {{ typesetter_requests_url }}

Regards,

{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to production managers upon typesetting task completion.
setting.name: typesetter_complete_notification

value.default:
Dear {{ production_assignment.production_manager.salutation_name }},

This is a notification from {{ request.user.full_name }} that typesetting for article {{ production_assignment.article.safe_title }} has been completed. You can view further information on the journal site.: {{ production_article_url }} /p>

Regards,

setting.description: Email sent to typesetters to acknowledge a completed task.
setting.name: typeset_ack

value.default:
Dear {{ production_assignment.editor.salutation_name }},

Production for article {{ article.safe_title }} has been completed.

Regards

{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to editors when production is complete.
setting.name: production_complete

value.default:
This is a notification to inform you that Production is complete for article "{{ article.safe_title}}".

Regards,

{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to typesetters to inform them that a task has been reopened.
setting.name: typeset_reopened

value.default:
Dear {{ typeset_task.typesetter.salutation_name }}

Thanks for your efforts typesetting the article, {{ typeset_task.article }}. This task has now been re-opened for further work: {{ proofing_requests_url }}

Regards,

{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Automated email sent to proofing manager when they are assigned.
setting.name: notify_proofing_manager

value.default:
Dear {{ proofing_assignment.proofing_manager.salutation_name }},

You have been assigned as the Proofing Manager: {{ proofing_article_url }} for {{ article.safe_title }}.

Regards,

{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to proofing managers on completion of a proofing task.
setting.name: notify_proofreader_complete

value.default:
Dear {{ proofing_task.round.assignment.proofing_manager.salutation_name }},

I have completed proofreading: {{ proofing_article_url }} for "{{ proofing_task.round.assignment.article.safe_title }}".


Regards,

{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to a proofreader when they are given an assignment.
setting.name: notify_proofreader_assignment

value.default:
Dear {{ proofing_task.proofreader.salutation_name }},

You have been assigned a proofreading task: {{ proofing_requests_url }} for "{{ article.safe_title }}". We would be most grateful for your assistance in proofreading this article.

Regards,

{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to typesetters requesting changes based on proofing feedback.
setting.name: notify_typesetter_proofing_changes

value.default:
Dear {{ typesetter_proofing_task.typesetter.salutation_name }},

Changes have been requested for article "{{ article.safe_title }}".

You can access this request from the requests page: {{ proofing_requests_url }} /p>

Regards,

{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to typesetters and proofreaders thanking them.
setting.name: thank_proofreaders_and_typesetters

value.default:
Dear {{ user.salutation_name }}

Thank you for your efforts during the production of "{{ article.safe_title }}".

Regards,

{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to editors when proofing is complete.
setting.name: notify_editor_proofing_complete
setting.pretty_name: Notify Editor that Proofreading is complete

value.default:
Dear {{ proofing_assignment.editor.salutation_name }},

Proofing for "{{ article.safe_title }}" is now complete.

Regards,

{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to the proofreader when the manager cancels their task.
setting.name: notify_proofreader_cancelled

value.default:
Dear {{ proofing_task.proofreader.salutation_name }},

The proofreading task for "{{ proofing_task.round.assignment.article.safe_title }}" that was due on {{ proofing_task.due }} has been cancelled.


{% if user_content_message %}{{ user_content_message|safe }}{% endif %}

Regards,

{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Notify the proofing manager that corrections are complete.
setting.name: typesetter_corrections_complete

value.default:
Dear {{ article.proofingassignment.proofing_manager.salutation_name }}

I have completed the proofing corrections: {{ proofing_article_url }} requested on "{{ article }}".

Regards,

{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Notify the author of their publication date and time.
setting.name: author_publication

value.default:
Dear {{ article.correspondence_author.salutation_name }}

We are pleased to say that your article, "{{ article.safe_title }}", is set for publication on {{ article.date_published|date:'Y-m-d' }} at {{ article.date_published|date:'H:i' }} {{ article.date_published.tzinfo.zone }}.

You may want to consider one or more of the following in order to promote your research:

  • Email a link to your paper to colleagues
  • Write a blog post about your paper
  • Upload it to your institutional repository or a subject repository.
  • Add to Wikipedia where appropriate

Regards,

{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Guidelines displayed to the proofreader.
setting.name: proofreading_guide

setting.description: Guidelines displayed to the editor on the review page.
setting.name: review_steps

value.default:
1. Add files to your review round.
  2. Select reviewers for your review round.
  3. Once reviews are complete decide if revisions are required, if they are: add a revision task.
  4. After revisions are complete, you may want to add a new round of peer review, go to: 1.

setting.description: Guidelines displayed to the editor on the copyediting page.
setting.name: copyediting_steps

value.default:
1. Start a copyedit assignment:
    • Choose a copyeditor
    • Choose the files available for the copyeditor
    • Add instructions and due date
  2. Request the author to review the copyedit task
  3. After the review, you can:
    • Accept the copyedit
    • Reopen the copyedit task and move back to step 1.

setting.description: Guidelines displayed to the production manager on the production stage.
setting.name: production_steps

value.default:
Recommended steps for completing the Production stage:
  1. Assign a Typesetter (optional){% if production_assignment.typeset_tasks %}  {% endif %}
    2. {% for task in production_assignment.typeset_tasks %}
  2. Review typesetting task by {{ task.typesetter.full_name }} {% if task.editor_reviewed %}  {% endif %}
    3. {% endfor %}
  3. Have at least one Galley file uploaded (required) {% if article.has_galley %}  {% endif %}

setting.description: Guidelines displayed to the proofing manager on the proofing stage.
setting.name: proofing_steps

value.default:
1. Select proofreaders for this proofing round.
  2. Once proofing is completed decide:
    • Request changes (sends the article back to the typesetter)
    • Acknowledge the task
  3. (optional) If changes have been completed, you may want to start a new round of Proofing and move to 1.
  4. Finally, click "Complete proofing"

setting.description: Tick this box to prevent non-staff users from accessing the site.
setting.name: maintenance_mode

setting.description: Message displayed when maintenance mode is enabled.
setting.name: maintenance_message

value.default: This server has been set to Maintenance Mode. It will be back shortly.

setting.description: Tick this box to display the editorial team link in the navigation bar.
setting.name: enable_editorial_display

setting.description: Tick this box to display the journal title in the top bar of your site (note this option is not supported on the Material theme).
setting.name: display_journal_title

setting.description: Tick this box to prevent the article's large image (header image) from being displayed on the article page.
setting.name: disable_article_large_image

setting.description: Tick this box to prevent article thumbnails from being displayed on public article lists.
setting.name: disable_article_thumbnails

setting.description: Tick this box to give editorial teams their own pages.
setting.name: multi_page_editorial
setting.pretty_name: Enable multi-page editorial team display (is overwritten by Enable team display).

setting.description: Email sent when a user requests a password reset.
setting.name: password_reset

value.default:
Dear {{ reset_token.account.salutation_name }},

A password reset for your account has been requested. You can reset your password at the following link:

{{ core_reset_password_url }}

setting.description: Email sent when a user registers.
setting.name: new_user_registration

value.default:
Dear {{ user.salutation_name }}

Thank you for registering for {{ site_name }}. You can confirm your account at the following link:

{{ core_confirm_account_url }}

setting.description: Tick this box to require senior editors to review and confirm decisions made by section editors.
setting.name: draft_decisions

setting.description: Tick this box to enable reviewers to save their progress in a peer review and come back later to complete it. We only recommend this for journals using particularly long review forms.
setting.name: enable_save_review_progress

setting.description: Email sent when a section editor makes a draft decision.
setting.name: draft_message

value.default:
A section editor has made a draft decision: {{ review_in_review_url }} regarding an article in your section: {{ article.safe_title }}.

The draft decision is [[DECISION TEXT ]].

Regards,

{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to editors when a section editor makes a draft decision.
setting.name: draft_editor_message

value.default:
{{ draft.section_editor.full_name }} has drafted a decision for {{ article.safe_title }}.

The section editor provided the following message:

{{ draft.message_to_editor|safe }}

You can view the draft decision on the journal site: {{ review_edit_draft_decision_url }}

setting.description: Email sent to editors when there is a new submission.
setting.name: editor_new_submission

value.default:
A new article, {{ article.safe_title }}, has been submitted.

You can assign an editor Here: {{ review_unassigned_article_url }}

Regards,

setting.description: Tick this box to only accept DOC, DOCX, RTF and ODT manuscript files during submission.
setting.name: limit_manuscript_types

setting.description: NOTE: This setting is deprecated--please use Notify Section Editors of Publication instead. Email sent to the Section Editor when the article is published.
setting.name: section_editor_pub_notification

value.default:
Dear {{ editor.salutation_name }},

An article that you served as section editor for, {{ article.safe_title }}, has been set for publication.

The article will be published on {{ article.date_published }}

Regards,

setting.description: Email sent to reviewers when the article they reviewed is published.
setting.name: peer_reviewer_pub_notification

value.default:
Dear reviewers,

An article that you served as peer reviewer for, "{{ article.safe_title }}", has been set for publication.

The article will be published on {{ article.date_published }}.

Regards,

setting.description: Tick this box to use one-click access links for peer review, allowing reviewers to access their review assignment directly from their email.
setting.name: enable_one_click_access

setting.description: Tick this box to show all active reviews on the review dashboard. If this box is not ticked, a count of completed reviews will be shown instead.
setting.name: enable_expanded_review_details

setting.description: Digest email sent to editors.
setting.name: editor_digest

value.default:
Unassigned Articles:

    {% for article in unassigned_articles %}
  • {{ article.safe_title }}
    • {% endfor %}

Overdue Reviews

    {% for review in overdue_reviews %}
  • {{ review.reviewer.full_name }} for article {{ review.article.safe_title }}.
    • {% endfor %}

Overdue Revisions

    {% for revision in overdue_revisions %}
  • {{ revision.article.correspondence_author.full_name }} for article {{ review.article.safe_title }}.
    • {% endfor %}

Overdue Proofing

    {% for proofing in overdue_proofing %}
  • {{ proofing.proofreader.full_name }} for article {{ proofing.round.assignment.article.safe_title }}
    • {% endfor %}

Awaiting Publication

    {% for article in awaiting_publication %}
  • {{ article.safe_title }}
    • {% endfor %}

setting.description: Email sent with a digest of outstanding review requests and overdue requests.
setting.name: reviewer_digest

value.default:
Review Requests

    {% for review in pending_requests %}
  • {{ review.article.safe_title }} due on {{ review.date_due }}
    • {% endfor %}

Overdue Requests

    {% for review in overdue_requests %}
  • {{ review.article.safe_title }} due on {{ review.date_due }}
    • {% endfor %}

setting.description: Email sent to revision people.
setting.name: revision_digest

value.default:
Revision Requests

    {% for revision in pending_requests %}
  • {{ revision.article.safe_title }} due on {{ revision.date_due }}
    • {% endfor %}

Overdue Requests

    {% for revision in overdue_requests %}
  • {{ revision.article.safe_title }} due on {{ revision.date_due }}
    • {% endfor %}

setting.description: You can set your DOI pattern. The default is ``{{ article.journal.code }}.{{ article.pk }}``.
setting.name: doi_pattern

setting.description: Used for URL generation.
setting.name: is_secure

setting.description: Username used to submit files for review by Similarity Check or iThenticate.
setting.name: username
setting.pretty_name: Username for Similarity Check or iThenticate

setting.description: Tick this box to display links to Similarity Check reports.
setting.name: enable

setting.description: Password used to submit files for review by Similarity Check or iThenticate.
setting.name: password
setting.pretty_name: Password for Similarity Check or iThenticate

setting.description: The editors selected will receive notifications of new submissions. If none are selected, all editors listed here are notified.
setting.name: editors_for_notification

setting.description: These guidelines will be displayed to reviewers when accessing the review.
setting.name: reviewer_guidelines

value.default:
Review feedback

  1. Recommendation:
    Please indicate which of the following options you recommend for this article: Accept; Minor Revisions; Major Revisions; Reject.
  2. Content and argument:
    Please comment on the originality, relevance and scholarly rigour of the article.
    Please comment on whether existing literature in this area has been considered.
    – Is any relevant work missing? 
    – Are references to existing work accurate?
    – Do the introduction and conclusion reflect the argument in the main text?
    Please comment on whether the abstract adequately summarises the article.
  3. Writing style:
    Please comment on the quality of the writing style.
    – Is the manuscript logically structured and does the argument flow coherently?
    – Does the introduction detail the argument in a logical way and does the conclusion adequately summarise it?
    – Are there any issues with spelling, punctuation and grammar?
  4. Figures:
    Please comment on the article’s use of tables, charts, figures, images or maps.
    Please note if any of the above are missing captions or keys, or require any further editing.
  5. Formatting:
    Please comment on the formatting of the article.
    – Does the manuscript adhere to the journal's guidelines?
    – Are citations and references formatted to house style?
  6. General comments
    If desired, please provide further comments and suggestions for improvement.

setting.description: Select the type of review to use as the default when creating a new review assignment for this journal.

setting.description: Email sent when a user is assigned to production.
setting.name: production_assign_article

value.default:
Dear {{ user.salutation_name }}

This is an automatic notification from {{ request.journal.name }} that you have been assigned to the production of article {{ article.safe_title }}. You can view further information on this on the journal site: {{ url }}

Regards,

setting.description: You can paste the webhook for Slack or Discord here.

setting.description: Send to a user specified in the notification manager.
setting.name: notification_submission

value.default:
Dear {{ notification.user.salutation_name }},

This email is to notify you that {{ article.correspondence_author.full_name }} has submitted article "{{ article.safe_title }}" to {{ article.journal.name }}.

You can review the metadata in the journal site: {{ review_unassigned_url }}

Regards,

setting.description: Email sent to copyeditors when a copyediting assignment is updated.
setting.name: copyedit_updated

value.default:
Dear {{ copyedit_assignment.copyeditor.salutation_name }},

Your copyediting assignment for article "{{ copyedit_assignment.article.safe_title }}" has been updated. The due date is set to: {{ copyedit_assignment.due }}.

Regards, {{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to copyeditors when a copyediting assignment is deleted.
setting.name: copyedit_deleted

value.default:
Dear {{ copyedit_assignment.copyeditor.salutation_name }},

Your copyediting assignment for article "{{ copyedit_assignment.article.safe_title }}" has been deleted. We no longer require you to undertake this task.

Regards, {{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to typesetters when a typesetting assignment is deleted.
setting.name: typeset_deleted

value.default:
Dear {{ typeset_task.typesetter.salutation_name }},

Your typesetting assignment for article "{{ typeset_task.assignment.article.safe_title }}" has been deleted. We no longer require you to undertake this task.

Regards, {{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to proofreaders when a proofing assignment is edited.
setting.name: notify_proofreader_edited

value.default:
Dear {{ proofing_task.proofreader.salutation_name }},

Your proofing assignment for article "{{ proofing_task.assignment.article.safe_title }}" has been updated. Its due it is now {{ proofing_task.due }}. If you cannot completed the task in this time, please get in touch by replying to this email.

Regards, {{ request.user.signature|safe }}

Before submitting you should read over the guidelines here, then register an account (or login if you have an existing account)

setting.description: Subject for the email when editors cancel or delete a correction task.
setting.name: subject_notify_correction_cancelled

setting.description: Email sent when editors cancel or delete a correction task.
setting.name: notify_correction_cancelled

value.default:
Dear {{ correction.typesetter.salutation_name }},

The correction task you were assigned for {{ article.safe_title }} has been cancelled.

Regards,

{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

Files intended for single or double anonymous review must have all identifying text removed.

  1. If the paper has a title page, remove any names or contact information.
  2.  Check the bibliography and the text for self-citation.
  3. Check for implied self-citation. The following phrases may indicate an author's identity and should therefore be edited:
    • I discussed in a previous paper..."
    • "I have previously shown..."
    • "My previous work...
  4. Remove any identifying metadata from the file.

Dear {{ revision.article.correspondence_author.salutation_name }},

Thank you for submitting your revisions for "{{ revision.article.safe_title }}". We will be in touch with further information about your submission soon.

Best wishes,

{{ revision.editor.full_name }}

setting.description: Email sent to a potential author when a staff member evaluates an access request.

value.default:
Dear {{ access_request.user.salutation_name }},

Your request to be granted the {{ access_request.role.name }} role on {% if access_request.journal %}{{ access_request.journal.name }}{% else %}{{ access_request.repository.name }}{% endif %} has been evaluated.

The decision made was: {{ decision }}.

The following note was provided by the staff member evaluating your request: {{ access_request.evaluation_note }}

Kind Regards,

{{ request.user.full_name }}

setting.name: display_completed_reviews_in_additional_rounds_text
setting.pretty_name: Display completed reviews in review interface text

value.default: When conducting multiple rounds of review, it is our policy to share the completed reviews from previous rounds with all reviewers. You can find these below.

setting.description: Email sent by editors to reviewers when sharing peer reviews.
setting.name: share_reviews_notification

value.default:
Dear {{ review.reviewer.salutation_name }},

We would like to express our gratitude for your valuable contribution as a peer reviewer for our article. At our journal, it is our policy to share completed peer reviews with all the reviewers involved. We would like to provide you with the opportunity to access not only your own review but also those of your peers.

To access the reviews, use the following link: {{ url }}

Thank you once again for your time,

{{ request.user.signature }}

setting.description: Subject for the email sent by editors to reviewers when sharing peer reviews.
setting.name: subject_share_reviews_notification

setting.description: If this box is ticked, author response letters (which they may provide when completing revisions) will also be made available when you share reviews with reviewers.
setting.name: share_author_response_letters

value.default:
{{ revision.article.correspondence_author.full_name|se_can_see_pii:revision.article }} has successfully completed the assigned revision task for article #{{ revision.article.pk }} - "{{ revision.article.title }}."

Please take a moment to review the revisions at {{ url }}.

Kind Regards,

setting.name: hide_editorial_group_names
notify_section_editors_of_publication
setting.description: Tick this box to copy in section editors on publication notification emails sent to authors.

setting.name: notify_peer_reviewers_of_publication
setting.description: Tick this box to notify reviewers when the paper is published. This will use a template from the Peer reviewer publication notification setting.
When this box is ticked, and a group member has their country set, the editorial team will display the group member's country.
setting.name: display_countries_editorial_team
setting.pretty_name: Display country on Editorial team page

setting.description: When this box is ticked, assigned section editors will not be able to see personally identifiable information about authors until a decision for an article has been made. The general setting Reply-To address should be set for this setting to work correctly.
setting.name: se_pii_filter
setting.pretty_name: Section editor personally identifiable information filter

setting.description: Email sent to typesetter on task assignment.
setting.name: typesetting_notify_typesetter

value.default:
Dear {{ assignment.typesetter.salutation_name }},

This is a notification from {{ request.user.full_name }} that you have been assigned to the production of article {{ assignment.round.article.safe_title }} on journal {{ request.journal.name }}.

You can view further information on this assignment: {{ typesetting_assignments_url }}.

Regards,

{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Subject for the typesetter assignment notification email.
setting.name: subject_typesetting_notify_typesetter

setting.description: Email sent to typesetting managers when a typesetter accepts a task.
setting.name: typsetting_typesetter_decision_accept

value.default:
Dear {{ assignment.manager.salutation_name }},

This is to notify you that {{ assignment.typesetter.full_name }} has accepted your assignment your assignment for {{ assignment.round.article.title|safe }}.

{% if note %}

They provided the following note:
{{ note|safe }}

{% endif %}

Regards,

setting.description: Subject for an email sent to typesetting managers when a typesetter accepts a task.
setting.name: subject_typsetting_typesetter_decision_accept

setting.description: Email sent to typesetting managers when a typesetter declines a task.
setting.name: typsetting_typesetter_decision_decline

value.default:
Dear {{ assignment.manager.salutation_name }},

This is to notify you that {{ assignment.typesetter.full_name }} has declined your assignment for {{ assignment.round.article.title|safe }}.

{% if note %}

They provided the following note:
{{ note|safe }}

{% endif %}

Regards,

setting.description: Subject for the email sent to typesetting managers when a typesetter declines a task.
setting.name: subject_typsetting_typesetter_decision_decline

setting.description: Email sent to typesetting managers when a typesetter completes a task.
setting.name: typesetting_typesetter_complete

value.default:
Dear {{ assignment.manager.salutation_name }},

This is to notify you that {{ assignment.typesetter.full_name }} has completed your assignment for {{ assignment.round.article.title|safe }}.

{% if note %}

They provided the following note:
{{ assignment.typesetter_note|safe }}

{% endif %}

Visit the article URL for more details: {{ typesetting_article_url }}

Regards,

setting.description: Subject for the email sent to typesetting managers when a typesetter completes a task.
setting.name: subject_typesetting_typesetter_complete

setting.description: Email sent to proofreaders on task assignment.
setting.name: typesetting_notify_proofreader

value.default:
Dear {{ assignment.proofreader.salutation_name }},

This is an notification from {{ request.user.full_name }} that you have been assigned to proofread {{ assignment.round.article.safe_title }} on journal {{ request.journal.name }}.

You can view further information on this assignment: {{ typesetting_assignments_url }}.

Regards,

{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Subject for the email sent to proofreaders on task assignment.
setting.name: subject_typesetting_notify_proofreader

setting.description: Proofreader guidelines
setting.name: typesetting_proofreader_guidelines

value.default:
The files below have been assigned to you for proofreading. You must check all files before you can mark this task as complete, including both the PDF and XML proofs (XML is the web display version of the article).

After downloading the files, you can then upload these with any annotations or corrections marked directly on the proofs. If needed, you can also add additional notes to the typesetter in the text box below.

Please note that proofreading comments will go back to a typesetter, and so should give concise and clear instructions on any minor corrections needed (do not include questions or optional requests – if you are unsure on something, discuss it with the assigning editor first).

setting.description: Subject for the email sent to editors when production is complete.
setting.name: subject_production_complete

setting.description: Email sent to editors when typesetting is complete.
setting.name: typesetting_complete

value.default:
Dear editors,

This is an automatic notification to inform you that Typesetting is complete for article "{{ article.safe_title}}".

Regards,

{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Subject for the email sent to editors when typesetting is complete.
setting.name: subject_typesetting_complete

setting.description: Email sent to editors when a proofreading task is complete.
setting.name: typesetting_proofreader_completed

value.default:
Dear {{assignment.manager.salutation_name}},

This is a notification to let you know that the proofing you requested for the article {{assignment.round.article.safe_title}}, with article number {{assignment.round.article.pk}}, has now been completed by {{assignment.proofreader.full_name}}.

Best wishes,

setting.description: Subject for the email sent to editors when a proofreading task is complete.
setting.name: subject_typesetting_proofreader_completed

setting.description: Email sent to proofreaders when a proofreading assignment is cancelled.
setting.name: typesetting_proofreader_cancelled

value.default:
Dear {{assignment.proofreader.salutation_name}},

This is a notification to let you know that your proofreading request for the article {{assignment.round.article.safe_title}}, with article number {{assignment.round.article.pk}} has been cancelled. This means that you no longer need to complete this proofreading task

Best wishes,

{{ assignment.manager.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Subject for the email sent to proofreaders when a proofreading assignment is cancelled.
setting.name: subject_typesetting_proofreader_cancelled

setting.description: Email sent to proofreaders when a proofreading assignment is reset (reopened).
setting.name: typesetting_proofreader_reset

value.default:
Dear {{assignment.proofreader.salutation_name}},

This is a notification to let you know that your proofreading request for the article {{assignment.round.article.safe_title}}, with article number {{assignment.round.article.pk}}, has been reopened. Please log in to the journal using this link in order to complete this proofreading request: {{ typesetting_proofreading_assignments }}.

Thank you for your help,

Best wishes,

{{ assignment.manager.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Subject for the email sent to proofreaders when a proofreading assignment is reset (reopened).
setting.name: subject_typesetting_proofreader_reset

setting.description: Email sent to typesetters when a typesetting assignment has been cancelled.
setting.name: typesetting_typesetter_cancelled

value.default:
Dear {{assignment.proofreader.salutation_name}},

This is a notification to let you know that your typesetting request for the article {{assignment.round.article.safe_title}}, with article number {{assignment.round.article.pk}}, has been cancelled. This means that you no longer need to complete this task.

Thank you for your help,

{{ assignment.manager.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Subject for the email sent to typesetters when a typesetting assignment has been cancelled.
setting.name: subject_typesetting_typesetter_cancelled

setting.description: Email sent to typesetters when a typesetting assignment has been deleted.
setting.name: typesetting_typesetter_deleted

value.default:
Dear {{assignment.proofreader.salutation_name}},

This is a notification to let you know that your typesetting request for the article {{assignment.round.article.safe_title}}, with article number {{assignment.round.article.pk}}, has been deleted. This means that you no longer need to complete this task.

Thank you for your help,

{{ assignment.manager.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Subject for the email sent to typesetters when an assignment has been deleted.
setting.name: subject_typesetting_typesetter_deleted

setting.description: Tick this box to enable CRediT support for this journal.
setting.name: use_credit

setting.description: Email sent to authors when sending a conditional accept revision request.
setting.name: conditional_accept

value.default:
Dear {{ article.correspondence_author.full_name|se_can_see_pii:article }},

We are pleased to inform you that your article has been conditionally accepted for publication, subject to the successful completion of the required revisions.

Details of the changes required are below:

{{ revision.editor_note|safe }}

You can view and respond to the revision requests here: {{ do_revisions_url }}

Please complete your revisions by {{ revision.date_due }}.

We look forward to receiving your updated manuscript.

Regards,
{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to authors when an article is desk rejected.
setting.name: review_decision_desk_reject

value.default:
Dear {{ article.correspondence_author.full_name|se_can_see_pii:article }}

Thank you for submitting your manuscript "{{ article.safe_title }}" to {{ article.journal.name }}. After careful consideration, we regret to inform you that your submission has not been selected for peer review.

We appreciate the opportunity to consider your work.

Regards,

{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Subject for conditional acceptance email sent to authors.
setting.name: subject_conditional_accept

setting.description: Subject for a desk rejection email sent to authors.
setting.name: subject_review_decision_desk_reject
